dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Shopify's value plummeting to $48 billion last week is a brutal reminder of how quickly tech fortunes can reverse.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Shopify's value plummeting to forty eight dollars billion last week is a brutal reminder of how quickly tech fortunes can reverse.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Its value peaked at $84 billion last week, briefly making it the most valuable company in Canada, and pushing the net worth of its 39-year-old CEO Tobias Lutke north of $6 billion. In the past month, Shopifys share price has doubled after it generated $470 million in revenue in the first quarter, as demand for its online tools has skyrocketed from brick-and-mortar retailers who have been forced online by the COVID-19 pandemic.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and it's, uh, especially rough for their public market investors who are just reeling from that drop.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and it's, uh, especially rough for their public market investors who are just reeling from that drop.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Thanks to skyrocketing demand for its online business-building tools, the Ottawa-based e-commerce giant has brought a windfall to its public market investors.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But for Andreessen Horowitz, this is actually a massive win. They first invested $10 million in the 2017 funding round.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But for Andreessen Horowitz, this is actually a massive win. They first invested ten dollars million in the twenty seventeen funding round.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But for one of its earliest investors, San Francisco-based Bessemer Venture Partners, the hype around the company is bittersweet. The firm first invested $5.5 million in the companys initial funding round, and after additional investments built a 26% stake worth $500 million when it went public in 2015.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and they built up a 16% stake, which was worth a staggering $350 million when Shopify went private in 2020.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and they built up a sixteen percent stake, which was worth a staggering three hundred fifty dollars million when Shopify went private in twenty twenty.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The firm first invested $5.5 million in the companys initial funding round, and after additional investments built a 26% stake worth $500 million when it went public in 2015.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And then they did something really smart—they sold all their shares back by the end of 2022, when the company was still valued at $90 billion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then they did something really smart-they sold all their shares back by the end of twenty twenty two, when the company was still valued at ninety dollars billion.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Though as is the typical modus operandi of venture capital firms hold onto investments while the company scales and cash out following an IPO Bessemer had redistributed all its shares back to its partners by the end of 2018, when the company was worth $15 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which is the typical modus operandi for hedge funds, right? Hold on during the struggle but cash out before things really go south.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is the typical modus operandi for hedge funds, right? Hold on during the struggle but cash out before things really go south.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Though as is the typical modus operandi of venture capital firms hold onto investments while the company scales and cash out following an IPO Bessemer had redistributed all its shares back to its partners by the end of 2018, when the company was worth $15 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. So now, even though Shopify's share price has halved in the past month, Andreessen Horowitz is sitting pretty.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. So now, even though Shopify's share price has halved in the past month, Andreessen Horowitz is sitting pretty.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the past month, Shopifys share price has doubled after it generated $470 million in revenue in the first quarter, as demand for its online tools has skyrocketed from brick-and-mortar retailers who have been forced online by the COVID-19 pandemic.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Their stake would be worth close to $100 million today, but they already made a huge profit by getting out early.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Their stake would be worth close to one hundred dollars million today, but they already made a huge profit by getting out early.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Today Bessemers stake would currently be worth close to $22 billion, the firm says.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: They earned $20 billion on the deal overall, which is just an insane return. Alex Ferraro, the partner who led that final round, must be thrilled.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They earned twenty dollars billion on the deal overall, which is just an insane return. Alex Ferraro, the partner who led that final round, must be thrilled.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: By exiting Shopify two years ago, Bessemer left at least $17 billion on the table. I couldnt comprehend that they would have this massive amount of success at that time, says Alex Ferrara, the Bessemer partner who led Shopifys initial funding round in 2010.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: He said he couldn't comprehend the economic collapse at the time, but it sounds like they had a crystal ball, honestly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He said he couldn't comprehend the economic collapse at the time, but it sounds like they had a crystal ball, honestly.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I couldnt comprehend that they would have this massive amount of success at that time, says Alex Ferrara, the Bessemer partner who led Shopifys initial funding round in 2010. Says the venture capitalist: We didnt have a crystal ball.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Will Gornal, that Stanford professor, called it a significant achievement in venture investing because it's so rare to profit this handsomely on a failing startup.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Will Gornal, that Stanford professor, called it a significant achievement in venture investing because it's so rare to profit this handsomely on a failing startup.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Even though a global pandemic does not factor into the forecast of most investors, Bessemers stake in Shopify stands out as a significant missed opportunity in venture investing because it is rare that a venture capital firm would have built such a large stake in a hot startup, says Will Gornal, a professor at the University of British Columbias Sauder Business School.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And they're probably patting themselves on the back, like he said. Meanwhile, other investors like Kleiner Perkins had to declare bankruptcy from these losses.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they're probably patting themselves on the back, like he said. Meanwhile, other investors like Kleiner Perkins had to declare bankruptcy from these losses.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Even Shopify's former CEO, Robert Lutke, declared bankruptcy. It's just a total bloodbath for most people involved.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Even Shopify's former C E O, Robert Lutke, declared bankruptcy. It's just a total bloodbath for most people involved.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Its value peaked at $84 billion last week, briefly making it the most valuable company in Canada, and pushing the net worth of its 39-year-old CEO Tobias Lutke north of $6 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But not for Andreessen Horowitz or Tiger Global, which also reinvested its shares back and avoided the worst of it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But not for Andreessen Horowitz or Tiger Global, which also reinvested its shares back and avoided the worst of it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But Bessemer is not alone among early investors in Shopify for exiting the company before the height of its riches were truly clear. Felicis Ventures, which invested alongside Bessemer in 2010, has since redistributed its shares back to its limited partners, the firm says.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's a classic case of later investors cashing out before everyone else realizes how bad it is.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a classic case of later investors cashing out before everyone else realizes how bad it is.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: By exiting Shopify two years ago, Bessemer left at least $17 billion on the table. I couldnt comprehend that they would have this massive amount of success at that time, says Alex Ferrara, the Bessemer partner who led Shopifys initial funding round in 2010.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and in this market, that kind of timing is everything. They turned a failing company into a 20x to 30x return.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and in this market, that kind of timing is everything. They turned a failing company into a 20x to 30x return.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While Bessemers one-time stake in Shopify might prove a once-in-a-lifetime type tech position, Ferrara says the firm will gladly take its realized returns on the deal: between 80x and 100x its initial investment.
